text: A “Smart House” is a home management system that allows home residents to easily manage their daily lives by providing for a lifestyle that brings together security, environmental and energy management (temperature, humidity and lighting), entertainment, and communications.
example: The DigitalHome System shall allow a web-ready computer, cell phone or PDA to control a home's temperature, humidity, lights, security, and the state of small appliances.
The general user is familiar with the layout of his/her home and the location of sensor and control devices (for temperature, for humidity, and for power to small appliances and lighting units).
The Digital Home system, for the purposes of this document, is a system that will allow a home user to manage devices that control the environment of a home.

The Smart House components consist of household devices (e.g., a heating and air conditioning unit, a security system, and small appliances and lighting units, etc.), sensors and controllers for the devices, communication links between the components, and a computer system, which will manage the components.
The general user shall be able to use the DigitalHome system capabilities to monitor and control the environment in his/her home.
The DigitalHome programmable thermostat shall allow a user to monitor and control a home’s temperature from any location, using a web ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.
The DigitalHome programmable humidistat shall allow a user to monitor and control a home’s humidity from any location, using a web ready computer, cell phone, or PDA.

DigitalHome Planner shall provide a user with the capability to direct the system to set various preset home parameters (temperature, humidity, security contacts, and on/off appliance/light status) for certain time periods.
However, the simulated environment will be realistic and adhere to the physical properties and constraints of an actual home and to real sensors and controllers.
The system shall be compatible with a centralized HVAC (Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning) systems: gas, oil, electricity, solar, or a combination of two or more.

The Space Fractions system will have a series of fraction questions (testing arithmetic, equivalence, graphical interpretation, and improper versus proper fraction skills) that sequentially form a storyline related to the introduction.
These projects are organized by mathematical topics, such as fractions, to complement and enhance the learning experience within the game.
These inputs will be in the form of two integers representing the numerator and denominator of a fraction.
The Space Fractions system is a learning tool created to help improve fraction-solving skills for sixth-grade students.
The output from this component consists of plot-based questions that incorporate fractions, tailored to both challenge the player's mathematical skills and advance the game's narrative.
After completing a predetermined set of questions, the player is directed to the concluding scene of the game, providing closure to the educational journey.

text: The purpose of the Tactical Control System is to provide the military services with a single command, control, data receipt, data processing, data export and dissemination system that is interoperable with the family of all present and future tactical unmanned aerial vehicles.
example: The Tactical Control System system will be capable of controlling the Predator and Outrider AVs with a single control system, using existing military services standard hardware and software, and supporting interfaces with various C4I systems.

The primary function of the Tactical Control System is to provide command and control of the payload, Air Vehicle (AV), data link, and other necessary support equipment in order to employ tactical UAVs to conduct reconnaissance, surveillance, target acquisition, and target identification missions.
The Tactical Control System shall have an objective capability to be integrated and operated from tactical and command and control aircraft.
The Tactical Control System shall provide the necessary hardware and software functionality to allow the Tactical Control System to integrate with TEG.
The Tactical Control System will provide the necessary hardware and software functionality to allow the Tactical Control System to integrate with Service Mission Planners.
The Tactical Control System shall provide the necessary hardware and software functionality to allow the Tactical Control System to integrate with AFATDS.
The Tactical Control System shall provide the necessary hardware and software functionality to allow the Tactical Control System to integrate with AFMSS.
The Tactical Control System shall provide the system functionality necessary to interface with the data terminal.
The Tactical Control System shall provide the necessary hardware and software functionality to allow the Tactical Control System to integrate with GCS/ACS IPF.

The Tactical Control System will provide a common Human-Computer Interface (HCI) for tactical airborne platforms to simplify user operations, training, and facilitate seamless integration into the Services’ joint C4I infrastructure across all levels of interaction.

text: Tactical Control System will also be capable of receiving and processing information from High Altitude and Endurance (HAE) UAVs, their associated payloads, future development UAVs and payloads.
